result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carlos A Ortega-Vasquez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Carlos A Ortega-Vasquez appeared by video.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy appeared by video for Carlos A Ortega-Vasquez.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel has discovery and requests time to review.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Carlos A Ortega-Vasquez appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Defendant appears in Court without counsel.  Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation. Defendant requests court appointed counsel at the county rate. Court appoints Attorney Nicholas Conrardy who shall be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. Court orders defendant to repay the County at a rate of $50.00/month beginning upon completion of the case and every month thereafter until paid in full.  Case adjourned for status conference in Branch 41.
Status conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
All previously ordered conditions of bail remain.

Defendant Carlos A Ortega-Vasquez in court.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference on 09-19-2022 at 08:30 AM, Branch 41.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Carlos A Ortega-Vasquez not in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO COMMISSIONER. Court takes no action as to bail.

Defendant Carlos A Ortega-Vasquez in court.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for pretrial conference. Defendant does not qualify for PD representation. Court holds colloquy with the defendant. Court adjourns case for the defendant to retain private counsel. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with VKV. 
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Carlos A Ortega-Vasquez in court.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 35.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7-6-2022 @1p
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on July 6, 2022, at 1:00 PM
